page.title: 13JOHN DICKINSON & CROXLEY
page.content: THE NAME DICKINSON IS VERY WELL KNOWN IN CROXLEY GREEN BECAUSE OF THE PAPER MILL JOHN DICKINSON BUILT BETWEEN THE GRAND UNION CANAL AND THE RIVER GADE IN 1830. WHEN THE MILL WAS FIRST BUILT CROXLEY WAS ONLY A HAMLET AND MOST OF ITS RESIDENTS WERE EMPLOYED IN FARMING. THE MILL NEEDED WORKERS AND THEY WERE RECRUITED FROM ALL OVER ENGLAND. TO HOUSE THEM, DICKINSON HAD HOUSES BUILT IN THE VILLAGE IN WHAT IS NOW KNOWN AS DICKINSON SQUARE. THERE WAS ALSO A DICKINSON GUILD HOUSE WHICH WAS THE LOCAL COMMUNITY CENTRE UNTIL DEMOLISHED SEVERAL YEARS AGO AND A DICKINSON GUILD OF SPORT WHICH STILL FUNCTIONS, BUT NO LONGER AS PART OF THE MILL, AS THAT WAS CLOSED IN DECEMBER 1980, JUST AFTER IT CELEBRATED ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY YEARS OF PRODUCTION.
